Reason: The _journalDiskSync configuration in the prevayler software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the synchronization frequency of journal disk writes. A lower value for _journalDiskSync would result in more frequent disk writes, increasing system overhead and potentially slowing down system performance. Conversely, a higher value would reduce the frequency of disk writes, potentially improving system performance by reducing disk I/O operations. Therefore, changes in the _journalDiskSync configuration can significantly affect system performance, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
